claim:
This study was conducted and reported following the SAGER guidelines and Strengthening the Reporting of Observational Studies in Epidemiology (STROBE), respectively [11, 12].Results
A total of 1872 articles were screened, of which 1844 met inclusion criteria for further analysis (Fig 1).
title: Fig 1. PRISMA journal article selection diagram.
caption: This figure depicts the methodology of journal article selection employed in this study, including search strategy, reasons for exclusion, and final record number.

claim: Characteristics of the articles included are reported in Table 1 and Fig 2.
title: Fig 2. Number of publications by gender for first authors.
caption: This figure shows the number of publications for first authors in each journal by gender.

This figure shows the number of publications for first authors in each journal by gender.Among the five journals, the percentage of articles with women as first authors ranged from 8 to 58% and from 9 to 35% for the last authors over the 5-year study period (Fig 3).

claim: The percentage of women first and last authors varied by state (Fig 6); however, there was no difference in women first and last authors by region or FWCI.
title: Fig 6.
caption: Percent Women SAO Providers (A), Articles with Women First Authors (B), and Articles with Women Last Authors (C) by State.
